reviews.text: Good easy-drinking beer thatâs better on draft than in a bottle.  This is your standard pale lager, donât expect much, but you can drink these all night with no problem.

Reminiscent of San Miguel Light possessing a very similar, citrusy and flowery element. A reasonable offering which is clear and pours with a small, slightly off white head. Not on the same par as the original Sapporo, but it still retains a surprisingly smooth hint of bitterness on swallowing, although this is still very mild when compared to the original. Quite refreshing and certainly worth a punt.

Doesnât look too bad on pouring, but it all goes downhill from there. A small head followed by a dull, oily and unusually sweet taste that I can only describe as being akin to âwet sugared paper or soggy cardboardâ followed up by a short but bitter after taste. Very cheap, very poor and quite frankly vile. Avoid like the proverbial plague!
